title: UmerIdrees
author: UmerIdrees
created_time: May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 08:34:25 PM by UmerIdrees
content: One of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.Keep in mind that we live in a country where we are not allowed to buy and sell through bitcoin. Therefore he is selling the shirts in the fiat currency however all the shirts have Bitcoin logo over it. This is the maximum he can do to promote bitcoin. I hope when some day bitcoin may become a legal tender here also, then he can do the transactions in Bitcoin.Link of the store ishttps://store.ilmeaalim.com/en/

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: This is a business and also a very good idea because indirectly those who wear clothes with the bitcoin logo can introduce bitcoin to people who still don't know bitcoin when wearing it. And with this, people who are still not familiar with it will be lured by nice t-shirts with the bitcoin logo, because if they are interested in those t-shirts with the bitcoin logo, they will ask what is bitcoin. Or they can look for it themselves by looking for it on the internet if curious.although bitcoin is now popular but I'm sure there are still many people who don't know about it at all, and introducing various ways to show the bitcoin logo is a good move.and in my opinion the t-shirt with the bitcoin logo that you are displaying is very good and also matches the color of the shirt and the color of the writing or the bitcoin logo, very interesting.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: I can say that this is good, but again, does he explain to his customers what Bitcoin is before selling it to them? Because there is no link like bitcoin.org on the cloth. Why am I asking? Because I know there are people who have zero knowledge about Bitcoin, if such people buy this kind of cloth, they could just be wearing it without knowing what it is, or someone who sees it might not equally know what it is. For example, there are some signs or stickers one will see on clothes, and you will just overlook them and conclude that they're just a design.And also, I hope it's safe to wear those clothes around your country because I noticed that the online store you publish here doesn't allow someone outside your country to buy them yet. So if people only living in your country are the only ones to buy those shirts, is it safe to publicly wear them since buying and selling Bitcoin is not allowed in your country? Just concerned about safety. You know, some countries are so strict with their rules that they punish any idea that tends to go against the regulations.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: That's a good one if the main idea is to raise awareness to the people that are going to see that t-shirt. If that's an affordable price to most then that will be a successful business and aim. But then, there have been news and reports about $5 wrench attacks and this can be one of the ways for these attackers to determine if someone holds and owns a bitcoin.That will be easy for them to know their targets. Yes, it's possible that it can happen but I'm not telling it that it shall bring the whole negativity to anyone who's going to wear it but, it's just about the reality that has happened to the others.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Well he has done so. Unfortunately very well but don't  you think  he his already a suspect in his country already? A d since bitcoin  is already banned in your country, I wouldn't advice him to keep identifying himself with bitcoin directly as it might be so some point a disobedience to the officials and government  agency? And he might even at some point as well be tag for conspiracy against the government  which is a very big offense that might lead to a brutal consequences.There are other ways he would have done  this than putting himself in a big mess and also placing a price on the t-shirts I'm wouldn't be a nice idea because you don't expect to buy a t-shirt for that amount and still be at the risk of bearing the consequences  of wearing the t-shirt.Whatever  the case might be, your friend should be more careful  and try staying  low key on cryptocurrency in your country now.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Quote from: UmerIdrees on May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMOne of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.What the influencer in your country is doing is more of business than it is of passion. I have seen some people share out Bitcoin Mertc for free just for the awareness purposes.But in this case I can see someone who is trying to use bitcoin popularity for his own good and it’s so sad people are actually taking advantage of that, he is lucky that there one person that has trade marked bitcoin if not that won’t be possible.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: This is a great idea which comes from him. Every bitcoin enthusiast and lover wishes to find a way to spread bitcoin knowledge in their community, but some are unable to do so due to the severe restrictions on the use of bitcoin in such areas. If what he's done won't get him in trouble, he should keep going since I'm convinced he'll generate more sales with this design because it'll be unique in that area. What he has done has also helped to raise awareness of bitcoin in some way. People will be curious about what the inscription on the new clothes implies when they see them. As a result, the public is aware of it, and his goal of sharing bitcoin awareness has been accomplished.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: This is one huge leap for your friend as it shows he is more passionate about spreading the gospel of Bitcoin than making profits off any tshirts design business he must have considered. I primarily like the idea and hope that others with access to the means or technology, should broadcast Bitcoin in their own way. This would help create more awareness.I hope he knows much about Bitcoin, so he could mentor anyone who asks about it, or have good association with other Bitcoin enthusiaste willing to share knowledge.

comments.author: carlfebz2
comments.body: Quote from: UmerIdrees on May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMOne of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.Keep in mind that we live in a country where we are not allowed to buy and sell through bitcoin. Therefore he is selling the shirts in the fiat currency however all the shirts have Bitcoin logo over it. This is the maximum he can do to promote bitcoin. I hope when some day bitcoin may become a legal tender here also, then he can do the transactions in Bitcoin.Link of the store ishttps://store.ilmeaalim.com/en/So far here in our country on which its still that in neutral phase when it comes to Bitcoin or overall crypto space but just like on what you had elaborated on here on which there are people or businesses who do really attached up these logos into their business to create or show some awareness which is really that good in overall adoption and recognition.One of examples (online stores)https://www.techinasia.com/bitcoins-spend-7-merchants-accepting-bitcoins-philippinesBut if we do speak about international list then it would be good on reading this one out.https://icoholder.com/blog/places-accept-bitcoin/Recognition doesnt stop and it would really be keeping on progress on which we know that not all places or countries does have that similar approach specially ifgovernment does really make out such opposing step, then as a business owner it is really hard to make out some integrations.

comments.author: Bitstar_coin
comments.body: I think this is a good initiative and also a good way of spreading the btc awareness to as many people as possible. Although some people may not understand what the logo stands for but with the bitcoin written next to logo will help them to understand.Bitcoin is not legal in my country as well but people can still engage in transacting btc. Thanks to this type of promotion individually, the btc awareness keeps increasing.

comments.author: Vaculin
comments.body: Quote from: UmerIdrees on May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMOne of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.Keep in mind that we live in a country where we are not allowed to buy and sell through bitcoin. Therefore he is selling the shirts in the fiat currency however all the shirts have Bitcoin logo over it. This is the maximum he can do to promote bitcoin. I hope when some day bitcoin may become a legal tender here also, then he can do the transactions in Bitcoin.Link of the store ishttps://store.ilmeaalim.com/en/ He has a unique way of promoting bitcoin for public awareness, and besides he’s also earning profits as well, so it’s a 2 in 1 business. This will certainly pave its way for more people to get attracted and interested with bitcoin, and it’s now the people’s initiative on how to lengthen their understanding with bitcoin through doing their own diligence in researching. However, while some crypto advocates will appreciate this, but I’m also sure that this will trigger those anti-bitcoin banks and governments, especially if you are living in a country where the government is banning the existence of bitcoin.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: He has done a wonderful job by promoting Bitcoin in his country in the form of designs on t-shirts. Such initiatives are very important in promoting Bitcoin in areas where people aren't well aware of the technology. He's truly a Bitcoin lover and his love for crypto-currency can be seen in those t-shits.I really appreciate the efforts of the guy as such steps are important in promoting awareness about Bitcoin in a community. Even if Bitcoin is banned in the country but still he's selling the shirts with Bitcoin logo and designs on them. The day when Bitcoin becomes a legal tender in the country, people will admire the efforts of this person.Bitcoin should be promoted by everyone in those areas where people aren't aware about it. The innovation can bring so many opportunities to the people of those areas. Many of those people can be financially stable if they adopt Bitcoin. It's truly a valuable coin and anyone who promotes it is also very valuable. Thumbs up for the guy!

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: This is a good step and the best way to promote bitcoin adoption and acceptance across the globe. But there's this question I want to asked, since bitcoin trading (buying/selling) isn't allowed in your country don't you think this is contrarily going against your country law?What if they found out that he is indirectly promoting bitcoin what would government do to him or her?Actually I love the whole concept of helping for wide spread of bitcoin so I think he should only sells to the country that accepts the buying and trading of bitcoin in other to remain a law abiding citizen.Then what if a fellow here wants to order for the T-shirts how would they be able to make payment because it would required them to pay through your friend's local currency which I think it may not be pretty nice to them over here IMO. Although I don't think if others have this in mind to ask here.

comments.author: Finestream
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on May 09, 2023, 07:54:41 PMThat's a good one if the main idea is to raise awareness to the people that are going to see that t-shirt. If that's an affordable price to most then that will be a successful business and aim. But then, there have been news and reports about $5 wrench attacks and this can be one of the ways for these attackers to determine if someone holds and owns a bitcoin.That will be easy for them to know their targets. Yes, it's possible that it can happen but I'm not telling it that it shall bring the whole negativity to anyone who's going to wear it but, it's just about the reality that has happened to the others. True. I think this is very possible for those scammers to easily trace bitcoin hodlers since wearing bitcoin T-shirts only means that you are a believer and a long time investor in bitcoin, and that you be could owning already a lot of bitcoin profits. Though this idea is very good for public awareness, but it will also trigger the safety of those people who are actually making profits from bitcoin. That’s why most bitcoin earners are just hiding their identities so they can avoid crypto scammers.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: This is truly a nice one coming from someone who truly believes in Bitcoin but is limited by the law to actually practice it, but has used the little means that he has to promote it within his locality by printing a customized T-shirt with different Bitcoin logos. Which is one of the massive means of promotion.Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on May 09, 2023, 07:44:32 PMI can say that this is good, but again, does he explain to his customers what Bitcoin is before selling it to them? Because there is no link like bitcoin.org on the cloth. Why am I asking? Because I know there are people who have zero knowledge about Bitcoin, if such people buy this kind of cloth, they could just be wearing it without knowing what it is, or someone who sees it might not equally know what it is. For example, there are some signs or stickers one will see on clothes, and you will just overlook them and conclude that they're just a design.Yes, your question is on point. The idea of also teaching and educating the customers about what they are actually buying and not just the design is good. But on the other hand, we should also look at the fact that there might actually not be a need for that, because the country might also be against it since they have a legal ban on the currency within their jurisdiction. Seeing someone orally promote and educate people about something that's actually not supposed to be traded in the country might attract the authorities. On the other hand, people who buy clothes now don't just buy them because of the mere design; most people buy them because they actually understand what the design might actually mean.

comments.author: GideonGono
comments.body: I have a friend who also did the samething, actually it feels nice and somehow proud to wear a t-shirt with a cryptocurrency logo since other could recognize it, and there are times that some stranger or workmates would actually open up a topic and talk to you about crypto when they see the t-shirt.

comments.author: Pity Token
comments.body: I don't see many Bitcoin logos anywhere on clothing, it would be a great marketing scheme to see it on the streets. I've seen shoes on the internet with the bitcoin logo but never seen anyone wearing them. Hope to see those T-Shirts in real life one day

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: UmerIdrees on May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMOne of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.It is good, these kind of stores where you can get items that carry Bitcoin logos have always been, this just increases accessibility to this items the more. Asides T-shirts, he can also look to include other items like mugs, hats, pens, etcetera. So that people who have no interest in buying T-shirts but like to have an item with Bitcoin logo will have other options to choose from. That way he can increase his sales, and also help increase the awareness he is trying to raise to all corners.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: I have nothing against it, another way to promote or bring awareness to BTC.However, I'm wary about the $5 wrench attacks appear to be on the rise in the crypto community. Criminals are everywhere, and maybe it they see you wearing a Bitcoin tshirt, they might think that you are a enthusiast and obviously have some in your mobile phone and they might follow you at home and attempt to rob you, just saying.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: UmerIdrees on May 09, 2023, 07:13:25 PMOne of the influencer in my country has started the business of selling the shirts with bitcoin logo on it. This will not only help him get some business but at the same time, it is a step towards the crypto awareness.It had to take an influencer to make this bold move when the real OGs of crypto watch from a distance and in the shadows...Its understandable as people respect their privacy and don't want to let the world know  of their tech hobbies but this BTC  t-shirt branding is a great idea if masses do actually buy and put on the Ts on a regular basis, otherwise  exchanges and gambling companies are doing the most as they have these sponsorship deals with big teams which get the visibility boost out there.Quote from: Pity Token on May 09, 2023, 09:54:28 PMI don't see many Bitcoin logos anywhere on clothing, it would be a great marketing scheme to see it on the streets. I've seen shoes on the internet with the bitcoin logo but never seen anyone wearing them. Hope to see those T-Shirts in real life one dayIf you are a sports fan, several teams have this on their shirts and ads running on stadium led billboards and what not.
